author: Staff Reporter
text:
A day after the father of a youth, who attempted suicide, alleged that a sub-inspector had harassed his son, an internal probe by the Deputy Commissioner of Traffic Police (South) revealed that the policeman had not made any attempt to contact the youth.

“We have verified the phone records of SI Saravana Bhaskar. He has had not made any calls to Ranjith or his relatives,” said a senior official. “We spoke to victim’s father. He has also extended his full cooperation,” the official said, adding they were checking the phone records of every officer at the station.

The allegation was made after 22-year-old Ranjith, who was riding a motorcycle, knocked down a senior citizen at the Air Force Station Road in Tambaram in December. His father alleged that the SI had called his son regularly, demanding money.

The Madhavaram police arrested a youth at Ponniammanmedu on Saturday night on the charge of possessing unaccounted money.

M. Saravanan (22) was travelling in a truck from Mayiladuthurai in Nagapattinam district. His vehicle was stopped by the police, who noticed Rs. 13 lakh inside.
title: SI did not harass youth, say police
